cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, forecast to slow and stall near or just inland, then drift slowly east-northeast toward the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi/Port O’Connor

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: None in upper Texas coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island (includes Beaumont/Port Arthur area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island and into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely; gusts could approach hurricane force if the center tracks closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft above ground possible along the upper Texas coast including the Sabine-Neches waterway and Beaumont area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches with locally higher amounts possible, producing life-threatening flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents that can disrupt port operations.
